text: See You at Regis Debray is a 2005 film written and directed by C.S. Leigh and starring Lars Eidinger as the film's only character. Set in 1969, the film sees Andreas Baader hiding in Régis Debray's (who was imprisoned in Bolivia at the time) apartment in Paris. It contains only ten scenes. The film features an original score by Japanese experimental musician Ryoji Ikeda. It also features Leonard Cohen's song "Hey, That's No Way to Say Goodbye". ==References== ==External links== * Category:2005 films Category:2005 drama films Category:British drama films Category:British films Category:Films set in Paris Category:Films set in 1969
title: See You at Regis Debray
